channel.title: Exoscale CLI on exo - the Exoscale command-line tool
channel.description: Recent content in Exoscale CLI on exo - the Exoscale command-line tool

item.title: exo
item.description: exo [command] [flags] Options --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --help, -h - help for exo --output-format, -O - Output format, can be table|json|text --output-template - Template to use if output format is "template" --use-account, -A - Account to use in config file [env EXOSCALE_ACCOUNT] SEE ALSO exo affinitygroup - Affinity groups management exo api - Exoscale api exo config - Manage config for exo CLI

item.title: exo api account list
item.description: Synopsis Lists accounts and provides detailed account information for listed accounts http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/listAccounts.html exo api account list [flags] Options --id - List account by account ID --iscleanuprequired - list accounts by cleanuprequired attribute (values are true or false) --keyword - List by keyword --name - List account by account name --page - --pagesize - --state - List accounts by state. Valid states are enabled, disabled, and locked. --help, -h - help for list

item.title: exo api address associate
item.description: Synopsis Acquires and associates a public IP to an account. http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/associateIpAddress.html exo api address associate [flags] Options --interval - healthcheck definition: time in seconds to wait for each check. Default: 10, minimum: 5 --mode - healthcheck definition: healthcheck mode can be either 'tcp' or 'http' --path - healthcheck definition: the path against which the 'http' healthcheck will be performed. Required if mode is 'http', ignored otherwise. --port - healthcheck definition: the port against which the healthcheck will be performed.

item.title: exo api address deleteReverseDNSFromAddress
item.description: Synopsis delete the PTR DNS record from the public IP address http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/deleteReverseDnsFromPublicIpAddress.html exo api address deleteReverseDNSFromAddress [flags] Options --id - the ID of the public IP address --help, -h - help for deleteReverseDNSFromAddress Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --debug, -d - debug mode on --dry-run, -D - produce a cURL ready URL --output-format, -O - Output format, can be table|json|text

item.title: exo api address disassociate
item.description: Synopsis Disassociates an ip address from the account. http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/disassociateIpAddress.html exo api address disassociate [flags] Options --id - (required) the id of the public ip address to disassociate --help, -h - help for disassociate Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --debug, -d - debug mode on --dry-run, -D - produce a cURL ready URL --output-format, -O - Output format, can be table|json|text

item.title: exo api address list
item.description: Synopsis Lists all public ip addresses http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/listPublicIpAddresses.html exo api address list [flags] Options --allocatedonly - limits search results to allocated public IP addresses --associatednetworkid - lists all public IP addresses associated to the network specified --forloadbalancing - list only ips used for load balancing --forvirtualnetwork - the virtual network for the IP address --id - lists ip address by id --ipaddress - lists the specified IP address --iselastic - list only elastic ip addresses

item.title: exo api address queryReverseDNSForAddress
item.description: Synopsis Query the PTR DNS record for the public IP address http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/queryReverseDnsForPublicIpAddress.html exo api address queryReverseDNSForAddress [flags] Options --id - the ID of the public IP address --help, -h - help for queryReverseDNSForAddress Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --debug, -d - debug mode on --dry-run, -D - produce a cURL ready URL --output-format, -O - Output format, can be table|json|text

item.title: exo api address update
item.description: Synopsis Updates an IP address http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/updateIpAddress.html exo api address update [flags] Options --interval - healthcheck definition: time in seconds to wait for each check. Default: 10, minimum: 5 --mode - healthcheck definition: healthcheck mode can be either 'tcp' or 'http' --path - healthcheck definition: the path against which the 'http' healthcheck will be performed. Required if mode is 'http', ignored otherwise. --port - healthcheck definition: the port against which the healthcheck will be performed.

item.title: exo api address updateReverseDNSForAddress
item.description: Synopsis Update/create the PTR DNS record for the public IP address http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/updateReverseDnsForPublicIpAddress.html exo api address updateReverseDNSForAddress [flags] Options --domainname - the domain name for the PTR record. It must have a valid TLD --id - the ID of the public IP address --help, -h - help for updateReverseDNSForAddress Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --debug, -d - debug mode on

item.title: exo api network create
item.description: Synopsis Creates a network http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/createNetwork.html exo api network create [flags] Options --displaytext - the display text of the network --endip - the ending IP address in the network IP range. Required for managed networks. --endipv6 - the ending IPv6 address in the IPv6 network range --gateway - the gateway of the network. Required for Shared networks and Isolated networks when it belongs to VPC --ip6cidr - the CIDR of IPv6 network, must be at least /64

item.title: exo api network delete
item.description: Synopsis Deletes a network http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/deleteNetwork.html exo api network delete [flags] Options --id - (required) the ID of the network --forced - Force delete a network. Network will be marked as 'Destroy' even when commands to shutdown and cleanup to the backend fails. --help, -h - help for delete Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --debug, -d - debug mode on

item.title: exo api network list
item.description: Synopsis Lists all available networks. http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/listNetworks.html exo api network list [flags] Options --canusefordeploy - List networks available for vm deployment --id - List networks by id --issystem - true If network is system, false otherwise --keyword - List by keyword --page - --pagesize - --physicalnetworkid - List networks by physical network id --restartrequired - List networks by restartRequired --specifyipranges - True if need to list only networks which support specifying ip ranges

item.title: exo api network listNetworkOfferings
item.description: Synopsis Lists all available network offerings. http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/listNetworkOfferings.html exo api network listNetworkOfferings [flags] Options --availability - the availability of network offering. Default value is Required --displaytext - list network offerings by display text --guestiptype - list network offerings by guest type: Shared or Isolated --id - list network offerings by id --isdefault - true if need to list only default network offerings. Default value is false --istagged - true if offering has tags specified

item.title: exo api network update
item.description: Synopsis Updates a network http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/updateNetwork.html exo api network update [flags] Options --changecidr - Force update even if cidr type is different --displaytext - the new display text for the network --endip - the ending IP address in the network IP range. Required for managed networks. --guestvmcidr - CIDR for Guest VMs,Cloudstack allocates IPs to Guest VMs only from this CIDR --id - (required) the ID of the network --name - the new name for the network

item.title: exo api offering list
item.description: Synopsis Lists all available service offerings. http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/listServiceOfferings.html exo api offering list [flags] Options --id - ID of the service offering --issystem - is this a system vm offering --keyword - List by keyword --name - name of the service offering --page - --pagesize - --restricted - filter by the restriction flag: true to list only the restricted service offerings, false to list non-restricted service offerings, or nothing for all.

item.title: exo api offering listDetails
item.description: Synopsis List resource detail(s) http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/listResourceDetails.html exo api offering listDetails [flags] Options --resourcetype - (required) list by resource type --fordisplay - if set to true, only details marked with display=true, are returned. False by default --key - list by key --keyword - List by keyword --page - --pagesize - --resourceid - list by resource id --value - list by key, value. Needs to be passed only along with key --help, -h - help for listDetails

item.title: exo api offering listLimits
item.description: Synopsis Lists resource limits. http://cloudstack.apache.org/api/apidocs-4.4/user/listResourceLimits.html exo api offering listLimits [flags] Options --id - Lists resource limits by ID. --keyword - List by keyword --page - --pagesize - --resourcetype - Type of resource. Values are 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13. 0 - Instance. Number of instances a user can create. 1 - IP. Number of public IP addresses an account can own. 2 - Volume.

item.title: exo api user registerUserKeys
item.description: Synopsis This command allows a user to register for the developer API, returning a secret key and an API key. This request is made through the integration API port, so it is a privileged command and must be made on behalf of a user. It is up to the implementer just how the username and password are entered, and then how that translates to an integration API request. Both secret key and API key should be returned to the user http://cloudstack.

item.title: exo dns
item.description: exo dns [command] [flags] Options --help, -h - help for dns Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --output-format, -O - Output format, can be table|json|text --output-template - Template to use if output format is "template" --use-account, -A - Account to use in config file [env EXOSCALE_ACCOUNT] SEE ALSO exo - Manage your Exoscale infrastructure easily exo dns add - Add record to domain

item.title: exo dns add
item.description: exo dns add [command] [flags] Options --help, -h - help for add Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG] --output-format, -O - Output format, can be table|json|text --output-template - Template to use if output format is "template" --use-account, -A - Account to use in config file [env EXOSCALE_ACCOUNT] SEE ALSO exo dns - DNS cmd lets you host your zones and manage records

item.title: exo dns add A
item.description: Synopsis Add an «A» record that points your domain or a subdomain to an IP address. exo dns add A <domain name> [flags] Options --address, -a - Example: 127.0.0.1 --help, -h - help for A --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here. --ttl, -t - The time in seconds to live (refresh rate) of the record.

item.title: exo dns add AAAA
item.description: Synopsis Add an «AAAA» record that points your domain to an IPv6 address. These records are the same as A records except they use IPv6 addresses. exo dns add AAAA <domain name> [flags] Options --address, -a - Example: 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:EA75:1337:BEEF --help, -h - help for AAAA --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here. --ttl, -t - The time in seconds to live (refresh rate) of the record.

item.title: exo dns add ALIAS
item.description: Synopsis Add an «ALIAS» record. An ALIAS record is a special record that will map a domain to another domain transparently. It can be used like a CNAME but for a name with other records, like the root. When the record is resolved it will look up the A records for the aliased domain and return those as the records for the record name. Note: If you want to redirect to a URL, use a URL record instead.

item.title: exo dns add CAA
item.description: Synopsis A Certification Authority Authorization (CAA) record is used to specify which certificate authorities (CAs) are allowed to issue certificates for a domain. What is a flag? https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6844#section-3 exo dns add CAA <domain name> [flags] Options --flag, -f - An unsigned integer between 0-255. --help, -h - help for CAA --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here.

item.title: exo dns add CNAME
item.description: Synopsis Add a «CNAME» record that aliases a subdomain to another host. These types of records are used when a server is reached by several names. Only use CNAME records on subdomains. exo dns add CNAME <domain name> [flags] Options --alias, -a - Alias for: Example: some-other-site.com --help, -h - help for CNAME --name, -n - You may use the * wildcard here. --ttl, -t - The time in seconds to live (refresh rate) of the record.

item.title: exo dns add HINFO
item.description: Synopsis Add an «HINFO» record is used to describe the CPU and OS of a host. exo dns add HINFO <domain name> [flags] Options --cpu, -c - Example: IBM-PC/AT --help, -h - help for HINFO --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here. --os, -o - The operating system of the machine, example: Linux --ttl, -t - The time in seconds to live (refresh rate) of the record.

item.title: exo dns add MX
item.description: Synopsis Add a mail exchange record that points to a mail server or relay. These types of records are used to describe which servers handle incoming email. exo dns add MX <domain name> [flags] Options --help, -h - help for MX --mail-server-host, -m - Example: mail-server.example.com --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name> --priority, -p - Common values are for example 1, 5 or 10

item.title: exo dns add NAPTR
item.description: Synopsis Add an «NAPTR» record to provide a means to map a resource that is not in the domain name syntax to a label that is. More information can be found in RFC 2915. exo dns add NAPTR <domain name> [flags] Options --a - Flag indicates the next lookup is for an A or AAAA record. --help, -h - help for NAPTR --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here.

item.title: exo dns add NS
item.description: Synopsis Add an «NS» record the delegates a domain to another name server. You may only delegate subdomains (for example subdomain.yourdomain.com). exo dns add NS <domain name> [flags] Options --help, -h - help for NS --name, -n - You may use the * wildcard here. --name-server, -s - Example: 'ns1.example.com' --ttl, -t - The time in seconds to live (refresh rate) of the record. Options inherited from parent commands --config, -C - Specify an alternate config file [env EXOSCALE_CONFIG]

item.title: exo dns add POOL
item.description: Synopsis Add a «POOL» record that aliases a subdomain to another host as part of a pool of available CNAME records. This is a DNSimple custom record type. exo dns add POOL <domain name> [flags] Options --alias, -a - Alias for: Example: 'some-other-site.com' --help, -h - help for POOL --name, -n - You may use the * wildcard here. --ttl, -t - The time in seconds to live (refresh rate) of the record.

item.title: exo dns add SRV
item.description: Synopsis Add an «SRV» record to specify the location of servers for a specific service. exo dns add SRV <domain name> [flags] Options --help, -h - help for SRV --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here. --port, -P - The 'TCP' or 'UDP' port on which the service is found. --priority - Priority --protocol, -p - This will usually be 'TCP' or 'UDP'.

item.title: exo dns add SSHFP
item.description: Synopsis Edit an «SSHFP» record to share your SSH fingerprint with others. exo dns add SSHFP <domain name> [flags] Options --algorithm, -a - RSA(1) | DSA(2) | ECDSA(3) | ED25519(4) --fingerprint, -f - Fingerprint --fingerprint-type - SHA1(1) | SHA256(2) --help, -h - help for SSHFP --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here. --ttl, -t - The time in seconds to live (refresh rate) of the record.

item.title: exo dns add TXT
item.description: Synopsis Add a «TXT» record. This is useful for domain records that are not covered by the standard record types. For example, Google uses this type of record for domain verification. exo dns add TXT <domain name> [flags] Options --content, -c - Content record --help, -h - help for TXT --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here.

item.title: exo dns add URL
item.description: Synopsis Add an URL redirection record that points your domain to a URL. This type of record uses an HTTP redirect to redirect visitors from a domain to a web site. exo dns add URL <domain name> [flags] Options --destination-url, -d - Example: https://www.example.com --help, -h - help for URL --name, -n - Leave this blank to create a record for <domain name>, You may use the '*' wildcard here.

Required if mode is http. --healthcheck-port - the healthcheck port (e.g. 80 for http). --healthcheck-strikes-fail - the number of times to retry before declaring the IP dead. --healthcheck-strikes-ok - the number of times to retry before declaring the IP healthy.

item.title: exo firewall add
item.description: Synopsis No arguments create a IPv4 wide open rule. For ICMP rules, specify the icmp-code and icmp-type. firewall add <security group> --protocol icmp --icmp-type 8 --icmp-code 0 For the other protocols specify the port ranges. firewall add <security group> --protocol tcp --port 8000-8080 A set of predefined commands exists, such a ssh, ping or minecraft. firewall add <security group> ssh exo firewall add <security group name | id> [ssh | telnet | rdp | .
